body:
jason and dgk. jason was the biggest poweruser before the reddit exodus, and he got banned for "doxxing" bardfinn, *who already published their name anyway*. So in reality, it wasn't dox, it was the admins' excuse to get rid of jason. Not necessarily deliberate, but I think they made an extremely biased decision.

DGK was similar. He was given write access to ruqqus on github, so he said so on his profile. However, he had arguments with the admins, so they removed him from that, and because he didn't remove it from his profile that very millisecond, they *permanently* banned him for "staff impersonation" and refused to accept any appeal whatsoever. That was his first offense afaik.
body_html:
jason and dgk. jason was the biggest poweruser before the reddit exodus, and he got banned for "doxxing" bardfinn, who already published their name anyway. So in reality, it wasn't dox, it was the admins' excuse to get rid of jason. Not necessarily deliberate, but I think they made an extremely biased decision.

DGK was similar. He was given write access to ruqqus on github, so he said so on his profile. However, he had arguments with the admins, so they removed him from that, and because he didn't remove it from his profile that very millisecond, they permanently banned him for "staff impersonation" and refused to accept any appeal whatsoever. That was his first offense afaik.

body:
They banned me from discord for hitler worship.

Why even integrate a service like Ruqqus into a shitshow like Ruqqus?

Likewise to how Reddit was full of powermods, the Ruqqus power users are all the fuckers that are constantly in a discord channel for this site, but they rarely if ever post here because 'but discord is better!'.

THEN. WHY. ARE. YOU. ON. RUQQUS. IN. THE. FIRST. PLACE?

body:
You know Deuxrama banned me on reddit because I posted a public photo of one of their users, which they themselves had already posted on the sub, plus a look alike porn star with 'They are the same picture' memes?

They classified that as doxxing when I didnt post his name (didn't even know it) or any identifiable information. They didnt even remove the so called 'dox' post, they left up what they classified as doxxing for everyone to still see and simply banned me for it. The photo I used had already been posted by the person, I just put it side by side with an almost identical looking naked guy.

The guy himself was beyond livid, mad, and crying beyond crying to delete it just because he happened to look similar to someone with nude videos on pornhub. Usually that kind of shit is exactly want the Drama subs want, but they, like all places, work on a priority of whichever user is more liked and popular.
body_html:
You know Deuxrama banned me on reddit because I posted a public photo of one of their users, which they themselves had already posted on the sub, plus a look alike porn star with 'They are the same picture' memes?

They didnt even remove the so called 'dox' post, they left up what they classified as doxxing for everyone to still see and simply banned me for it. The photo I used had already been posted by the person, I just put it side by side with an almost identical looking naked guy.

The guy himself was beyond livid, mad, and crying beyond crying to delete it just because he happened to look similar to someone with nude videos on pornhub. Usually that kind of shit is exactly want the Drama subs want, but they, like all places, work on a priority of whichever user is more liked and popular.

body:
Uhh, *ME*, smart? Fuck no. I'm the stupidest person on this whole website. Everyone else here is super talented and I can't even glue anything I want together. I nearly fail at even taking charge of conversation on here. People deny it to me but they still subconsciously know, as any time there's any kind of group effort I'm the only one they don't see fit to invite at the very beginning. I only noticed the discord situation because the admins fucked with me a bit and my super-talented friends except for me all got mod positions and guildmastership everywhere, otherwise I too would think it's just overblown conspiracy nonsense.

Also I can't have any white or jewish dna, I'm a vulptex.

parent.body:
You know Deuxrama banned me on reddit because I posted a public photo of one of their users, which they themselves had already posted on the sub, plus a look alike porn star with 'They are the same picture' memes?

They classified that as doxxing when I didnt post his name (didn't even know it) or any identifiable information. They didnt even remove the so called 'dox' post, they left up what they classified as doxxing for everyone to still see and simply banned me for it. The photo I used had already been posted by the person, I just put it side by side with an almost identical looking naked guy.

The guy himself was beyond livid, mad, and crying beyond crying to delete it just because he happened to look similar to someone with nude videos on pornhub. Usually that kind of shit is exactly want the Drama subs want, but they, like all places, work on a priority of whichever user is more liked and popular.

body:
That hasn't been my experience. I've made suggestions and have at least discussed my ideas, and sometimes my feedback is well taken. I'm not the most active user on the Discord, either. If the more active people are right in front of the admins, then get in front of them yourself.

It seems like you're rightfully jaded after your experiences on Reddit, and that drives how you're seeing the current situation. I would just suggest putting feedback in and see how it goes.

body: The admins are definitely more responsive than on reddit, but my point is a lot of the userbase isn't really on discord and they are separate communities. I've noticed that the culture of the two is actually considerably different, yet the discord has all the power. There's also the issue that the discord is quite circlejerky and a few popular users say something and everyone else just bandwagons with them, including the admins a lot of times, which consolidates nearly all the influence into a few hands. And yes, this type of setup is exactly what led to what we have on reddit.
body_html: The admins are definitely more responsive than on reddit, but my point is a lot of the userbase isn't really on discord and they are separate communities. I've noticed that the culture of the two is actually considerably different, yet the discord has all the power. There's also the issue that the discord is quite circlejerky and a few popular users say something and everyone else just bandwagons with them, including the admins a lot of times, which consolidates nearly all the influence into a few hands. And yes, this type of setup is exactly what led to what we have on reddit.

body:
>the discord is quite circlejerky and a few popular users say something and everyone else just bandwagons with them, including the admins a lot of times

I myself don't spend that much time on discord. Can you give some examples of this?

One thing I do notice is that users here tend to upvote the admins even if their responses aren't *that* helpful (Like [here](https://ruqqus.com/+RuqqusMentions/post/5cqy/why-some-americans-are-trading-in/iidl?context=3), someone was talking about jasonkhanlar's ban, and cap's comment got more upvotes than the parent comment even though he didn't mention the ban or make any clarifications about the doxxing rule)

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
the discord is quite circlejerky and a few popular users say something and everyone else just bandwagons with them, including the admins a lot of times

I myself don't spend that much time on discord. Can you give some examples of this?

One thing I do notice is that users here tend to upvote the admins even if their responses aren't that helpful (Like here, someone was talking about jasonkhanlar's ban, and cap's comment got more upvotes than the parent comment even though he didn't mention the ban or make any clarifications about the doxxing rule)

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]
